0.title: Several problems will be solved if PM Modi drops his ego: Sanjay Raut
0.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that several problems in the country will be solved if PM Narendra Modi drops his ego. "If the ego is set aside, then many issues plaguing society...will be solved. Someone should convey this to PM," he added. "Only one message of Gautam Buddha should be kept in mind...that is to leave ego," Raut stated.

1.title: Discrimination against Northeast students down due to PM Modi: Assam CM
1.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Wednesday said that discrimination against the students of Northeast India has reduced due to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's outreach. "If you look at the last 2-3 years, because of PM Modi's outreach to the northeast now racial discrimination against students of the northeast has suddenly gone down to a huge extent," he said.

2.title: UN peacekeeping convoy attacked in Mali; 1 killed, 3 injured
2.article_body: A UN peacekeeper was killed and three others were injured after their convoy came under fire in Mali on Wednesday. The firing lasted for about an hour by suspected terrorists who used small arms and rocket launchers, said a UN spokesperson. UN chief Antonio Guterres condemned the attack and offered condolences to the families of the victims, all Jordanians.

3.title: It's nothing but exploitation: SC on ₹9,000 salary of Odisha home guards
3.article_body: Commenting on ₹9,000 monthly salary of Odisha home guards, Supreme Court said it is nothing but exploitation. "How a home guard can survive...maintain his family on payment of ₹9,000 per month only...he is performing almost the same duties as other police personnel," SC said. SC asked Odisha government to reconsider its decision of paying ₹9,000 monthly only to home guards.

4.title: Temples got submerged but Raj uncle told us to shoot 'Satyam...' ending: Aditya
4.article_body: Actor Aditya Raj Kapoor said that his uncle and late actor Raj Kapoor told the team to "get a camera" and shoot the ending of the film 'Satyam Shivam Sundaram: Love Sublime' while the river water flooded the land and the temples got submerged. Aditya also said he did not meet Raj Kapoor for months after deciding to quit films.

5.title: As I look back at IPL 2022, I know deep down how much it has hurt: Pollard
5.article_body: MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard has shared a post on Instagram over MI's performance in IPL 2022, stating that he knows "deep down" how much it has hurt the fans. "But it didn't derail the spirit, determination and hard work that was put in by every single person. We definitely learnt a lot from this 2022 season," he added.

6.title: Police avert alleged mass sacrifice of goats in Vadodara; 5 booked
6.article_body: Five people were booked after police rescued around 20 goats from an alleged mass sacrifice in Vadodara on Tuesday. An organisation called People for Animals approached police with a tip-off about mass sacrifice, following which police accompanied by them raided the spot. People gathered to perform the superstitious ritual, however, managed to escape with around 15 of the rescued goats.

7.title: 3,712 new COVID-19 cases in India, 35% higher than yesterday
7.article_body: India has reported 3,712 COVID-19 cases, 2,584 recoveries and 5 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,745 COVID-19 cases and 6 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 19,509, while the death toll reached 5,24,641.

8.title: Gunman kills 4 before shooting himself at hospital in US
8.article_body: A man armed with a rifle and a handgun killed four people inside a medical building on a hospital campus in Tulsa, Oklahoma before fatally shooting himself, police said. Multiple injuries had also been confirmed, officials said. Police added that they were trying to determine the suspect's identity, who they estimated was aged between 35 and 40.

9.title: Amber issues statement after losing Depp's defamation trial, says 'I'm heartbroken'
9.article_body: Amber Heard, in a statement issued after she lost Johnny Depp's defamation trial, said, "I'm heartbroken that the mountain of evidence...wasn't enough to stand up to the disproportionate power...and sway of my ex-husband." Calling it a "setback", Amber added, "I'm sadder...that I seem to have lost a right I thought I had as an American- to speak freely and openly."

10.title: Why was Amber Heard awarded $2 million in defamation suit against Johnny Depp?
10.article_body: Amber Heard lost defamation trial after being sued by ex-husband Johnny Depp, but she received a compensatory $2 million in damages. Heard's $2 million came from her countersuit against Depp. The jurors rejected two of Heard's three counterclaims. They concluded she was defamed when Depp's attorney told media that Heard staged property damage to show to police after alleged fight.

11.title: 'Chaliye Hukum', Amit Shah jokingly tells wife Sonal after special screening of film
11.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah and his family watched Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj' at a special screening in Delhi on Wednesday. At the end of his speech, he began walking towards the exit but his wife Sonal remained standing, when the minister jokingly said, "Chaliye Hukum." Shah said he watched a film in theatre with his family after 13 years.

12.title: COVID-19 situation getting worse in North Korea: WHO
12.article_body: The WHO has said that they believe the COVID-19 situation in North Korea is "getting worse, not better". This comes even as the country reported less than 1 lakh new "fever" cases for a third consecutive day. The WHO, however, added that it was not in a position to make an adequate risk assessment of the situation on the ground.

13.title: She taught me how to run a company: Zuckerberg as Sandberg resigns as Meta COO
13.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg penned a note after Sheryl Sandberg stepped down as Meta COO after 14 years. "When Sheryl joined me in 2008...I was only 23 and I barely knew anything about running a company," he wrote. "Sheryl architected our ads business, hired great people, forged our management culture, and taught me how to run a company," he added.

14.title: Cong leader demands reopening of Hyderabad's Charminar for prayers
14.article_body: Telangana Congress leader Rashid Khan has started a signature campaign demanding the reopening of Hyderabad's Charminar for offering prayers. Prayers were earlier held, however, Muslims were debarred from offering prayers at the site two decades ago, he claimed. This comes amid the ongoing row over the restoration of an alleged temple complex on the Qutub Minar premises in Delhi.

15.title: Police take road accident victim to hospital in garbage van in Jodhpur, probe ordered
15.article_body: Police used a garbage van on Wednesday to take the body of a man to a hospital after he came under a bus in Rajasthan's Jodhpur. A probe has been ordered into it after a video of the incident surfaced on social media. "The victim was crushed under the wheels of the bus and died on the spot," police said.

16.title: 22-yr-old man killed for refusing to give beer bottles in Delhi, 3 held
16.article_body: A 22-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death by three men after he refused to give his beer bottles to them in Delhi's Adarsh Nagar, police said. The accused were nabbed after we conducted raids, DCP (North-West) Usha Rangnani added. The accused were in front of a mall after spending all their money and saw the victim carrying beer bottles.

17.title: The word 'Pan-India' is abused, sounds like euphemism for dubbed film: Adivi
17.article_body: Actor Adivi Sesh who will play the role of martyr Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan in his next film 'Major', said the word 'pan-India' has been abused, adding that it sounds like a "euphemism" for a dubbed film. "It sounded good in the beginning," added Adivi. Talking about 'Major', Adivi stated every scene was shot, wrote and designed in Hindi.

18.title: Told Bobby of dream to work with him, did song step in front of him: Esha
18.article_body: Talking about Bobby Deol, actress Esha Gupta said, "I...[danced] to 'Duniya Haseenon Ka Mela' at...parties...I told him about me dancing to his [song] and...did the step in front of him." Esha stated that Bobby laughed a lot, adding she shared her childhood dream of working with him. "I...[grew] up watching 'Gupt'...I wasn't old enough to understand...it's a crush," said Esha.

19.title: Lost 30 kg, my mom asked 'Why're you killing yourself': Randeep on Sarbjit
19.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda said he lost 30 kilos while preparing for 'Sarbjit'. He added that his mother, who was staying with him, left and asked why he was killing himself. "She said I can't see you do this...She tried to stop me...She would make things that I like," Randeep said, adding that his mother said she "can't take it anymore".

20.title: I'm not assessing my performances at all, just enjoying my game: Ashwin
20.article_body: Opening up on his recent performances, India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin said he's in a "very good space of mind" and "just enjoying" his game. "I'm not in that phase of my life where I'm thinking about what happened," added Ashwin. "The last two years have been hard on a lot of people but...kind and good to me," he further said.

21.title: BJP loves to weaponise pain of Kashmiri Pandits: PDP
21.article_body: The BJP loves to weaponise the pain of the Kashmiri Pandits, said the PDP in its monthly newsletter 'Speak Up' on Tuesday. Referring to the recent killing of a government official, Rahul Bhat, the article titled 'The Saffron Trojan Horse' said, "Kashmiri Pandits get teargassed by the police for protesting [against] the killing of Rahul Bhat."

22.title: Congress will come down to 30-35 seats in 2024 polls: Assam CM
22.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Wednesday said that it will be difficult for the Congress party to retain the status of the principal Opposition party in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "As per my assessment, they will come down to around 30-35 seats in 2024," Sarma added. Furthermore, Sarma said that the party treats all states with contempt.

23.title: Will work as small soldier under PM Modi: Hardik Patel ahead of joining BJP
23.article_body: Ahead of joining BJP on Thursday, Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel said he is going to start a new chapter in his life with the feelings of national, state, public and social interests. "I will work as a small soldier in the noble service of the nation under the successful leadership of PM Narendra Modi," Patel tweeted.

24.title: Man offered lift in SUV; robbed of phone on Pune-Mumbai Expressway
24.article_body: Two people were arrested on Wednesday for allegedly robbing a 32-year-old engineer of his mobile phone on Pune-Mumbai Expressway after offering him a lift. The accused had offered to drop the victim at Khopoli in exchange for money. After travelling a distance, the two threatened to kill him and snatched his mobile phone and dropped him near Talegaon Dabhade.

25.title: 3 soldiers injured in blast in J&K's Shopian: Kashmir Zone Police
25.article_body: Three soldiers were injured in a blast that occurred inside a private hired vehicle in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian, the police said on Thursday. The soldiers have been taken to a hospital for treatment, Kashmir Zone Police said in a tweet. The nature and source of the blast - grenade, IED or battery malfunction - is being investigated, it added.

26.title: 3 of family die after falling into septic tank in Haryana
26.article_body: Three members of a family reportedly died after falling into a 20-foot-deep septic tank in Haryana's Bichhor village on Tuesday. According to police, an eight-year-old boy fell into the tank while playing around. His father jumped into the tank to save him, followed by the man's older brother. They lost consciousness after inhaling poisonous gas and died, police said.

27.title: Man throws acid on colleague after fight in Bengaluru; arrested
27.article_body: A 30-year-old jewellery shop employee has been arrested for allegedly throwing acid at his colleague after a fight over a petty issue in Bengaluru. The incident reportedly took place when both the men went out to drink after work with two other friends. The victim, Mantu Santra, has suffered 30% burn injuries on his face, neck and chest.

28.title: Kenyan national attacks pedestrians with knife near Bombay HC, held
28.article_body: One person suffered serious injuries after a Kenyan national attacked at least seven pedestrians near Bombay High Court on Wednesday. Mumbai Police arrested the 50-year-old foreigner who also sustained injuries. Police said the accused got violent after a verbal altercation with his female friend following which he went on to attack pedestrians randomly from Parsi Bawdi area with a knife.

29.title: BMC issues fresh directive against use of plastic, warns penal action
29.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday issued fresh directives for citizens and owners of commercial establishments not to use banned plastic. According to a BMC official, in case of violation, a fine of ₹5,000 will be imposed for first offence. Further, a fine of ₹25,000 and three-month jail term will be imposed for every offence thereafter, the official added.

30.title: Tunnel work of Pune Metro slowed by 400- metre long rock: Officials
30.article_body: Maha Metro officials said that the ongoing work on the Pune Metro has been slowed down by a 400-metre length of hard rock. Reports said that the metro tunnel boring machine's (TBM) drilling site is near Budhwar Peth. A Maha Metro official said that of the six-kilometre tunnel, 25-metre work is remaining.

31.title: India's 1st deluxe train Deccan Queen connecting Mumbai, Pune completes 92 yrs
31.article_body: India's first deluxe train, Deccan Queen Express, that connects Mumbai and Pune, completed 92 years of service on Wednesday. "This train is the only one of its kind on Indian Railways to have a restaurant car [and] will now run with LHB [Linke Hofmann Busch] coaches from June 22," Central Railway's General Manager Anil Kumar Lahoti, said.
